creator: rschmid-apache@raptor.net
text:
It would be very useful if the Junit Report contained columns identifying the
author (Javadoc: @author) and last user (cvs: $Author: $) tags.  As a project
manager this would be a huge time saver when figuring out who should most likely
take responsibility for an error or failure in a test.

One useful option would be a toggle to display the authors only when
error/failures are detected.

Thanks

I am going to say wontfix as the @author tags are not usually the issue, it is
the SCM logs. 

1. there are tasks to get at the SCM log.

2. Cruise control, from 
http://sourceforge.net/projects/cruisecontrol/

is a tool to do a checkout, build and then send blame mail to anyone who changed
the build since the last successful run, produces web status pages, etc. It is
hard to get up and running, but we swear by it, even for Win32/C++ dev.
creator: stevel@apache.org
